newsitem.title: FRANCE: Trichet says deficit cuts to help jobs, growth.
newsitem.headline: Trichet says deficit cuts to help jobs, growth.

text.p: Bank of France governor Jean-Claude Trichet, saying deficit cuts were essential this year, argued the cuts would not only help France qualify for a single currency but also spur job creation and growth at home.
He was speaking at an annual press conference on the Bank's monetary policy.

Deficit and spending cuts "will enable (us) to consolidate the confidence of businesses and households, preserve the low level of our medium- and long-term market interest rates and so create the conditions for growth which creates jobs and fights against unemployment," he said in a prepared speech.
France is seeking to reduce its public deficits to three percent of gross domestci product this year to help qualify for monetary union planned from 1999.
